quest.name: Sands of Despair
journal: Lalah Jinjahl is eager to share tidings from the Sharlayan motherland.

In eager tones, Lalah informs you that the analysis of the mystery plant is complete. It has been determined to be muscmaloi, a variety of herb that possesses potent aether-fortifying properties, owing to which its cultivation is outlawed. Having been thwarted from obtaining it at the arboretum, the fugitives will likely seek other means of procurement, and Lalah has identified an apothecary at Lost Hope as a source for the herb. On your way to find this individual, you next make for Black Brush Station in central Thanalan.

No sooner do you arrive at Black Brush Station than you meet with a distressed woman who fits the description of the apothecary. She breathlessly explains that three strangers have suddenly set upon a customer of hers, and you and Lalah rush to Lost Hope and the man's aid.

True to your suspicions, the strangers are your fugitives─but who should the customer at their mercy be but Faldrinet. You force your way between the healer and his assailants, and a standoff ensues. After a tense exchange, Loifa uses his power to enhance an antling, but provoked to anger by Faldrinet, Mahaud and Ancel suddenly fall to their knees in pain. Though it is not immediately clear what is happening to them, your priority is to deal with the fell beast, which Faldrinet has lured away.
You catch up to the beast and put it down before it can cause harm. The deed done, you turn to assist Faldrinet.
Thanks to your ministrations, Faldrinet is soon back on his feet, and together you return to the scene of the confrontation with Loifa.

You find Mahaud and Ancel still suffering from their mysterious ailment. Observing their symptoms prompts Lalah to recall rumors of a forbidden procedure said to have been conducted by a Sharlayan healer years ago─rumors that were summarily dismissed by the Forum. Nevertheless, the fugitives' plight gives her cause to wonder...but Loifa offers no confirmation and simply mocks her naivety. Again they make to teleport away, but ere they do so, the apothecary hesitantly steps forward, having recognized Mahaud and Ancel as her children...

The confrontation thus concluded, the apothecary recounts her tale. Mahaud and Ancel are her adopted children, she explains, and when they were both gravely ill, a Sharlayan healer by the name of Guildivain appeared and offered to cure them. The man took them away, and she had not seen them for years...until they seemingly came for Faldrinet.

After Faldrinet takes his leave, the apothecary reveals that it was him rather than the fugitives who sought to purchase her muscmaloi. She also tells you about a merchant in Aleport from whom Faldrinet procures rare alchemical ingredients. The plot duly thickened, Lalah suggests returning to Idyllshire to ponder recent revelations.

Lalah confesses her confusion at recent developments, which seems to contradict her assumptions. The rumors of a renegade sage conducting depraved experiments are of particular concern, for the nature of the fugitives suggests there may be a kernel of truth to them─yet the Forum was nevertheless adamant in their denial. While she attempts to make sense of everything, you resolve to spend your time fruitfully by further honing your skills.

※The next sage quest will be available from Lalah Jinjahl upon reaching level 75.
objectives: Speak with Lalah Jinjahl at Black Brush Station.
Speak with Lalah Jinjahl in Idyllshire.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Wonderful timing, Forename! Remember that mystery plant I sent to Sharlayan for analysis? I received the results not long ago.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: It was muscmaloi, a herb that possesses potent aether-fortifying properties. Owing to its effect, its cultivation was outlawed some years ago.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: 'Tis most certainly why the fugitives came to Eorzea. Unable to obtain the herb in Sharlayan, they decided to procure it from the arboretum.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: They likely intend to use it in conjunction with the soul crystal to further enhance themselves. Though their motives are still a mystery, the fact remains that they have already caused harm and will continue to do so until they are brought to justice.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Now, as they failed to obtain muscmaloi here, they will need to look elsewhere. And I'm pleased to say that my informer has helped me to identify an apothecary who deals in the herb─and whom I suspect our quarry will seek out.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: This individual is a resident of Lost Hope in central Thanalan, and that is where we shall next take ourselves.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Mark my words, they won't escape this time! I'll suffer them to misuse the sage's noble art no longer, and much less with that soul crystal!

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: ...Ahem. If we are to catch the fugitives, we had best hurry. That said, we should take a moment to regroup and prepare at Black Brush Station before heading on to Lost Hope.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Good gods, such a dry and dusty place this is... What I wouldn't give for a bath right now...

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Uwaaah! H-How long have you been here!?

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: ...I-I mean, 'tis well you are here. Ahem. I've already replenished my supplies, so if you are ready, we may begin looking for the apothecary at once. A Hyuran woman whose facial tattoo should mark her out...

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: The fugitives are like to be searching for her too. We must find her before they─ ...Hm?

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: That woman yonder fits the description...but something appears to be amiss. Let us investigate.

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: Help me! Please!

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: What ails you, madam?

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: I was dealing with a customer when a group of bandits attacked us! I managed to flee, but he's still at their mercy!

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Worry not, we'll help you. Pray lead the way!

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: Thank you!

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: It could only be them!

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: They're over there...

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: It's indeed them... But wait─is that Master Faldrinet!?

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: It's over, villains!

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Lay down your arms, or else...

dialogue.name: LOIFA
dialogue.text: Or else...what?

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Answer me one thing.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: What is this all for? Why go to such lengths and forsake everything you had to obtain power? And why wield such power against good, well-meaning souls?

dialogue.name: LOIFA
dialogue.text: Good? Well-meaning?

dialogue.name: LOIFA
dialogue.text: You know nothing about us! Nothing! You're just fools who believe everything you've been fed!

dialogue.name: LOIFA
dialogue.text: I'm beginning to regret sparing you.

dialogue.name: LOIFA
dialogue.text: Do you feel it? The weight of the “sacred duty.” To strive for the betterment of mankind and stand as a beacon of hope...

dialogue.name: LOIFA
dialogue.text: ...To play with people's lives. Do you feel it? The weight of the sin?

dialogue.name: GUILDIVAIN
dialogue.text: You would speak of sin?

dialogue.name: GUILDIVAIN
dialogue.text: To do naught when a life might be saved─that is the greatest sin. Every day, unfortunate souls die without reason. At fate's whim. 'Tis the sage's duty to fight this injustice by whatever means he may.

dialogue.name: GUILDIVAIN
dialogue.text: If you understand this, then it is not too late for you. You may yet make something of your lives.

dialogue.name: LOIFA
dialogue.text: Shut your mouth!

dialogue.name: LOIFA
dialogue.text: If you're determined to protect that wretch, then I will consider you complicit!

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: Wait... I know you...

dialogue.name: GUILDIVAIN
dialogue.text: Rather too close to the settlement for comfort. I fear for the civilians.

dialogue.name: GUILDIVAIN
dialogue.text: They wouldn't stand a chance against such a fiend...as they would well know.

dialogue.name: ANCEL
dialogue.text: You...you bastaaard!

dialogue.name: LOIFA
dialogue.text: No! Don't let him provoke you!

dialogue.name: MAHAUD
dialogue.text: Ugh... Unnngh...

dialogue.name: LOIFA
dialogue.text: Stay with me! Listen to my voice!

dialogue.name: GUILDIVAIN
dialogue.text: We must lure the beast elsewhere and tend to it. Forename─would you mind assisting me?

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Go! I have the situation here in hand!

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Deal with the beast! Don't worry about me!

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: No...it's not possible...

dialogue.name: GUILDIVAIN
dialogue.text: Whew, thank you, my friend...and well fought! I daresay you're a born sage. Fascinating...

dialogue.name: GUILDIVAIN
dialogue.text: But come, we should return to the others. The villains may not remain stricken for long.

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: Will they be all right...?

dialogue.name: GUILDIVAIN
dialogue.text: Oh dear, it seems they are still under the weather.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Their condition is unchanged. We should probably take advantage of this and apprehend them...

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: But this symptom...

dialogue.name: MAHAUD
dialogue.text: Ungh... Arrrgh!

dialogue.name: LOIFA
dialogue.text: Hold on. I'm getting us out of here.

dialogue.name: ANCEL
dialogue.text: <pant> We're fine, Loifa...

dialogue.name: LOIFA
dialogue.text: No, you're not, and you know it!

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: It's the enhancement, isn't it? I know something of the procedure. Of its potency...and the harm it causes.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: There's a limit to the amount of corporeal aether a living being can harbor. As we grow up, it waxes; as we grow old, it wanes.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: A gradual, gentle process, if allowed to function in the natural fashion...

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: But complications may arise when one forcibly fortifies that aether─as a rogue “healer” was rumored to have been doing with live subjects some years ago.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: The man used an unproven procedure on countless souls─a forbidden procedure, known only to a select few sages.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: And though he succeeded in a few instances, those subjects suffered from debilitating side effects... But those rumors were denounced by the Forum as baseless. And yet...

dialogue.name: LOIFA
dialogue.text: Hmph. You'll believe anything they tell you, won't you? Naive fools...

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: ...What!?

dialogue.name: LOIFA
dialogue.text: Can you stand?

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: Wait. Please.

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: It's really you, isn't it? Mahaud... Ancel...

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: Yes. Yes, it is... My children... Oh, how you've grown...

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: <sob> Thank the Twelve you're alive...

dialogue.name: GUILDIVAIN
dialogue.text: 'Tis plain they are confused. I pity them.

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: Mahaud... Ancel...

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: I had the perfect chance to apprehend the fugitives. To complete my mission. But I couldn't...

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: It seems you know them─the ones called Mahaud and Ancel.

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: Of course. They're my adopted children.

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: They were orphaned at a young age, and I took them in and raised them as my own. Though none of us were related by blood, we became as close a family as any.

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: Ours was a quiet, comfortable life. But then one day Mahaud fell sick. She had a raging fever, and grew weaker with every passing moment... Aetherspurn, the illness is called.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: I've read about it─a rare disease wherein the body becomes unable to draw aether from food. There is no known cure, only palliative care.

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: Our troubles didn't end there. Even as we were struggling to look after Mahaud, a fell beast attacked our settlement...

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: Ancel tried to protect his sister and was badly hurt. The chirurgeon said that he would be bedridden for the rest of his days.

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: I didn't know what to do. Without the coin to care for them, I... My mind went to dark places. I began thinking of how I might spare them the pain. Spare us all.

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: It was in that state that he found me. A kindly traveler.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: ...A healer?

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: Yes. He offered to help Mahaud and Ancel and refused what little payment I tried to give. But he also said that their condition demanded special care and facilities. It would take years, many years. Desperate as I was, I accepted without hesitation. And so he left with my children...

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: It was hard not knowing what became of them. Wondering if I had made the right choice. But I clung to the hope that one day we would be reunited...and we were! We were... Oh, to finally see them again is...I haven't the words for it. And it matters not that they've changed.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: The healer... What was his name?

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: Guildivain, he called himself. A healer of some renown in his native Sharlayan, I believe.

dialogue.name: GUILDIVAIN
dialogue.text: A truly touching tale! Where there is life, there is hope─would you not agree?

dialogue.name: GUILDIVAIN
dialogue.text: Now then, if I am no longer needed here, I shall return to making my rounds.

dialogue.name: GUILDIVAIN
dialogue.text: Till next time, my aspiring sage.

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: I didn't have the chance to speak with Mahaud and Ancel properly, but whatever they've gotten involved with, I hope they will be all right...

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: I believe the danger is passed, but for good measure, I will ask the Immortal Flames to keep an eye on the area.

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: We're in your debt.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Now, if you do not mind telling me, was this your first time meeting Master Faldrinet?

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: Oh, no. He's a regular of mine, introduced by an acquaintance. And when he comes, he always takes a moment to treat those who are unwell.

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: To have so many kindly healers, Sharlayan must be a wonderful place indeed.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: ...And who is this acquaintance of yours, if I may ask?

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: A merchant in Aleport. Master Faldrinet buys alchemical ingredients from him─rare items sourced directly from Thavnair.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: I see... Out of curiosity, what did Master Faldrinet buy from you this time?

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: Oh, just the usual─a few sprigs of muscmaloi. He was actually the one who told me where to get the herb. Says it's used to treat certain serious illnesses.

dialogue.name: PHARMACY04069
dialogue.text: Well, if you'll excuse me, I must be returning to my stall. I don't know when, but I know my children will return, and I must work hard if I'm to give us better lives.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Let us return to Idyllshire for now. Recent events have given me much to ponder...

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Forename... Ashamed though I am to admit this, I'm no longer certain of the truth...

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: It wasn't Loifa and his accomplices who sought muscmaloi, but Master Faldrinet.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: No, what the fugitives want is Master Faldrinet himself.

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Clearly they bear a grievance against him...

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: If those despicable rumors were true, and one of ours was actually... But the Forum was adamant in their denial, and they surely wouldn't...

dialogue.name: LALAHJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Ahhh, my mind is running amok... Forgive me, but I need a moment to rein in my thoughts.
